body.p:
To his Excellency Thomas E Bramlet
Govnor of Kentucky --

Your Peitioner Nancy Allen you would respectfully State, that she was indicted for Keeping a disorderly House in the city of Louisville, and upon her trial ^in the city court of Louisville^ she were fined ^on Tuesday the 8th Inst^ Forty Dollars. She States that upon the trial She could not procure her witness and the trial was had and concluded she being unable to get her witness before the court. She states that if she could have gotten her witness to the court she could have establised the fact that she was a Quiet good neighbor that she always attended to own business and that her House was always Quiet and orderly. She further states that the is poor and unable to pay the fine without great distress to herself and family. She states that she is ^a^ free woman of colour having ^a^ Husband endeavoring to make an honest living by work. She therefore respectfully asks of your Excellency to remit the fine imposed upon her by the said Court, and She will ever pray. Septr 15th 1863
The undersigned respectively join in the above petition

Nancy Allen
S.A. Atchison
Jno. H Talbott
C K Fairfax
J P Gailbreath
H.C. Russell, D. M.
I as agent collected the rent of the House Nancy Allen lived in & never saw nor heard of any Disorderly conduct about the house.

I most respectfully join in the above prayer of this coloured woman, being familiar with the facts I do not believe that the persecution was urged for the public-good, but merely to gratify private feeling.

Much personal ill feeling certainly existed against the petitioner Nancy Allan which was clearly manifested by the witesses for the Comlth. Judging from facts, which have been made known to me since the trial, are upon which I can rely. I respectfully suggest that Executive clemency will have been justly bestowed if the fine were be remitted
From the facts stated above by Mr Reasor from his personal knowledge I think that Executive clemency would be properly bestowed by remitting the fine

Jefferson County
Remission
Refused
21st Sept/ 63
Tho E Bramlette
Ansd. 21st Sepr/ 63
